Setting up an instance for the GreenData mobile app
To customize
GreenData’s mobile app
for specific tasks and user preferences, a number of customizations need to be made in the web version of the app (on the instance).
The web version app settings allow defining:
start page of the mobile app
;
the composition and sequence of
menu items of the mobile application
;
the display of and access to system objects:
object type registry
;
object instance
;
dashboard
;
start a business process
by object.
The changes made at the instance will be displayed in the mobile application only after re-authorization.
Design theme
By default,
mobile application
uses the "Mobile Material" system theme.
To configure a custom theme, select the following items sequentially in
user profile menu
: Application Management → Theme designer.
The user can configure the theme if they have
access permissions
to the corresponding item
user profile menu
.
A new design theme can be created in the "Mobile app theme" section using the
button or using the copy option
in the hover of an existing theme.
The custom theme is edited in
theme designer
, which is displayed on the right side of the workspace after clicking on the icon in the theme hover
, the theme is deleted by clicking on the icon
followed by confirmation of the action in the modal window.
Changing the settings for the design theme is available to the user if they have
the permission
to "Write" the corresponding instance of the design theme. Otherwise, editing the theme will not be available.
The system theme can only be copied.
When setting up the
mobile application
theme, the color palette of the application elements is set for light and dark themes.
The theme designer specifies the name of the custom theme and defines the colors (the color palette for the light and dark themes are set in the appropriate sections):
The color is selected using the Color picker on the palette or by entering the color code in RGBA or HEX formats.
main – the main contrasting color of the application, which is used for buttons, the side menu and the header of the home page;
secondary – the color used for icon buttons, attributes, outlines, and lines;
tertiary – the color of links inside the application;
warnings – the color that is used for "warning" type notifications and as a warning marker;
errors – the color used for error alerts;
background – the background color of the profiles and registers;
text – the color of the main text, registers, headings in the profile and in the registry header.
To save edits in the theme designer, click on the "Save" button.
If necessary, the "Reset changes" button to undo the edits made and return to the last saved version can be used.
To use the theme, set the corresponding check:
The default theme will be displayed for all users of the application. In there is no of
access permissions
to "Read" the default user theme, the system theme "Mobile Material" will be displayed to the user.
Login pages
The authorization, registration, password recovery and change pages (hereinafter referred to as login pages) in the mobile application can be designed qccording to the user’s business idea and preferences.
Login pages are configured in
login page constructor
, which is accessed by sequentially selecting
user profile menu
items:  Application management → Theme designer.
The user can configure the login pages if they have
access permissions
to the corresponding
user profile menu
item.
The settings set in the constructor are adapted to display the pages in
mobile version of the application
after activating the "Apply settings in mobile application" switch in the "Mobile application" section and saving the settings.
The applied page display settings will be available to the user after reopening the authorization page.

Start page
By default, in the mobile app, the user can customize the start page by defining the visibility of standard widgets (more details in the
"GreenData Mobile App"
article).
The default menu view (its location) and buttons in the start page toolbar are defined via
system settings
of the mobile app.
The ability to set a custom start page in the mobile app is provided with the following settings:
When creating/customizing
start page
, the “Use in mobile app” switch must be activated.
If the start page is used as:
object, the “Use in mobile app” switch must be activated in the
visual
settings;
Recommendations for customizing an object’s visual for display in a mobile app are provided
below
.

below
.
The user must have permissions to view the page, more examples of issuing start page permissions can be found in the
article
.
Menu items
Mobile application menu items are configured in the registry of the “Mobile application menu” object type, for quick access to which
sequentially select
main menu items
:
Administration → Settings → Mobile menu settings.
By default, the mobile application menu contains the following items: "Tasks", "Dashboards", "Chats" and "Contacts".
These items cannot be deleted, but it is possible to hide unnecessary ones via
access to system objects
, where security principal (users/access groups) should be removed from the “Read” permission of the corresponding instances of the “Mobile application menu” object.
The visibility of the menu item to go to the web version of the application and the ability to send performance logs via the “Settings” menu item are specified via
system settings
of the mobile application.
Adding a new item to the menu of the mobile application is done by clicking
and selecting the type of the menu item to be created:
Object - opening an
object
profile;
Registry - opening
registry type
;
The visual of an object opened from the registry is controlled by
registry setting
"Visual on opening".
Tasks - opening a list of user tasks that are grouped by “Today”, “This week”, and “All” periods;
The visual of the task opening is defined in
stage settings
.
External link - opening an external link in the browser of the mobile device.
Next, the parameters of the selected type of mobile application menu item are defined:
Setting
Purpose
Name
The name of the menu item in the mobile application.
Identifier
Identifier for recognizing the object in the System.
It is allowed to enter an identifier of up to 23 characters, without spaces and special characters, consisting of letters of the Latin alphabet, digits and underscores starting with a letter.
Order
Specifying the order of the item in the menu.
The order of system objects cannot be changed.
Icon
The icon that will be placed next to the menu item.
The icon is selected from the drop-down list.
Expanded by default
The parameter is not supported in the mobile version of the application.
Parent menu item
Parameter is not supported in the mobile application.
Algorithm to determine object
Selecting the algorithm to determine the object that will be opened by clicking on the menu item.
A previously created algorithm is selected from the drop-down list,
creating a new algorithm
is done via the parameter action menu.
The parameter is displayed when customizing the menu item of the mobile application of the “Object” type.
Algorithm to determine visual (optional)
Selecting an algorithm to determine the visual of the object that will be opened when the menu item is clicked.
A previously created algorithm is selected from the drop-down list,
creating a new algorithm
is done via the parameter action menu.
If the object visual is not specified, the first visual of the object with the active “Use in mobile application” setting is displayed considering the availability of access permissions.
Recommendations for customizing the visual of an object for display in a mobile app are provided
below
.
The parameter is displayed when customizing the menu item of the mobile application of the “Object” type.
Object type to display
Selecting the type of object whose registry is to be opened by clicking on the menu item.
When setting up a menu item of the “Tasks” type, the object type “WF. Process task” object type and its child types are available for selection.
The parameter is displayed when customizing the menu item of the mobile application of the “Registry”/“Tasks” type.
Registry
Selecting the registry to be opened by clicking on the menu item.
Only registries of the “Flat registry”, “Light registry” or “Tile registry” type are available for displaying a menu item of the “Registry” type.
If no option is specified, then the default registry is displayed.
The parameter is displayed when customizing the menu item of the mobile application of the “Registry”/“Tasks” type.
Link
A link to go to an external resource that will open a browser (third-party application) on the mobile device when clicked.
The parameter is displayed when setting the menu item of the mobile application of the “External link” type.
It is required to save the entered data by clicking on
.
Object setup
To display an object in the mobile app, follow these steps:
Open a previously created or
create new object type
.
Go to
type registry
and create/open the object.
Go to
visual
edit mode using
and customize the visual according to the following guidelines:
when setting up
grouping
, it is recommended to arrange elements in one
column
, if needed - no more than two columns;
do not overload the interface with a large number of rows, columns and tabs, as it is important to keep the data simple and readable;
consider the screen scale of your mobile device;
To see an example of a customized visual, it is possible to switch to developer mode in the browser and enable the mobile view of the page display by specifying the necessary screen parameters.
note that some
widgets
and
visuals for attribute
are not available in the mobile app.
List of supported widgets.
"Employee Information" widget
;
"Comments to the object" widget
;
"Reactions and comments to the object" widget
;
"Button" widget
;
"Map point" widget
;
"Media" widget
(video only);
"Title by attribute" widget
;
"Image" widget
;
"Tip" widget
;
"Text message" widget
;
"Attach files" widget
;
"Figure" widget
.
Save the visual by clicking the
button in the control panel or the “Ok” button in the element panel.
Open the
visual
settings via the actions menu available by clicking
.
Activate the “Use in mobile app” toggle and save the changes.
Grant the required
permissions
to work with the object.
If an object is selected to be displayed on
start page
or in
menu item
, it is possible to select the displayed visualization.
More information about configuring the object visual (including task) opened from the registry is
below
.
If the visual of the object is not specified, the first visual of the object with the active “Use in mobile application” option will be displayed if the corresponding access permissions are granted.
Buttons and actions
The buttons and actions configured for display in
object control panel
in the web version have a number of features when displaying the same object in the header in the mobile version:
no more than three buttons are displayed on the right side of the object header.;
in some cases,
icon will be displayed as one of the three possible buttons. Clicking on it opens a context menu containing:
buttons that cannot be placed in the header due to exceeding the maximum allowed number;
action buttons where the name is not hidden in the settings or the icon is not set;
when placing buttons, the order is considered: first, the basic buttons for working with the object are displayed
,
,
, if available there are free places in the header according to the specified order – action icons (in the settings of which the name is hidden), if necessary, the
button is added;
The save button
can be
redefined
by the batch action "Save and exit".
is not displayed in the object header
To update the data, use the basic functionality of the user interface of the mobile application – swipe down on the screen.
only actions available for the mobile application can be displayed in the object header (more information
below
);
names and icons of actions can be
redefined
when configuring related object types (with the exception of the "Favorites" action);
icon is always used to display the "Favorites".
Using dashboards
It is possible to place
dashboard
with customized analytical dashboards in the mobile app.
However, it is worth considering that only the following analytical dashboards are supported in the mobile app:
Table
;
Structural diagram
;
Dynamics chart
;
Universal graph
;
Control element
.
Using registry
The mobile format supports displaying registries of the “Flat registry” ,
“Light registry”
,
“Tile registry”
, and
“Task registry”
types.
Column visibility is determined depending on the registry type:
in a flat registry, only one column is supported to be visible;
in
tile registry
up to two columns can be placed;
in the
light registry
, all columns of the selected registry are displayed. The width of the registry columns is adjustable in
settings
registry.
This extends the last column placed on the device screen to the right margin, while the remaining columns can be viewed using horizontal scrolling.
Opening an object from the registry.
When opening an object from the registry, the visual specified in
registry settings
in the “Object visual when opening” parameter is used.
The visual when opening a task is specified by
stage settings
.
If the visual of the object is not specified, the first visual of the object with the “Use in mobile app” option activated will be displayed if the required permissions are granted.
Buttons and actions
The buttons and actions configured for display in the registry control panel in the web version have a number of features when displaying the same registry in the header in the mobile version:
The buttons locked in the web version are not displayed in the mobile application;
If there is no permissions to create an object,
and
buttons are not displayed.
the ability to start an action is supported only in the registry of the
"Tile registry"
type  via the "Override click" option.
Using actions
The mobile application supports the following system actions:
Start process;
Save;
Back;
Favorites,
as well as actions that are configured as a user interface module that specify "Call algorithm" or "Perform algorithm redirect".
The use of batch actions is not supported.
Business process customization
To work with business processes, including
tasks
, it is necessary to create the corresponding
business processes
in the web version of the platform and to
customize
them for use in the mobile app.
To verify that the connection between the mobile app and the platform is working correctly, follow the steps:
Open an empty object registry in the mobile app.
Create an object instance and start a business process.
Open a task in the mobile application, fill in the required data and save the task profile without completing it.
Verify that the data is displayed both on the platform and in the mobile app.
Complete the task in the mobile app and on the platform to make sure that there is a correct connection between them.
